revised_title: Photochemical and Thermal Formation of Colour Centres in Potassium Azide Crystals
tldr: The authors investigate the photochemical and thermal formation of color centers in potassium azide crystals. They discover that irradiation with ultra-violet light and heating cause the development of color centers, which are accompanied by the decomposition of the salt and the evolution of nitrogen. The coloration is studied spectro-photometrically, and a detailed picture of the photochemical and thermal processes is obtained. The findings provide insights into the relationships between the various absorption bands observed in potassium azide and the corresponding centers.
